intro: Romanschulzia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan romanschulzia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
